Class UnionFind

  • java.lang.Object
    • UnionFind

  • public class UnionFind
extends java.lang.Object
    Union-find data structure
    Loosely based on Robert Sedgewick's and Kevin Wayne's implementation
    Sauce: ftp://91.193.236.10/pub/docs/linux-support/computer%20science/data%20Structures%20&%20algorithms/%5BPearson%5D%20-%20Algorithms,%204th%20ed.%20-%20%5BSedgewick,%20Wayne%5D.pdf
    By Sarkis Ter Martirosyan and Neil Thistlethwaite
    Reuse permitted with credit where credit is due

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UnionFind(int n)
      Instantiates an emtpy union-find data structure with n nodes, [0, n).

    • Constructor Detail

      • UnionFind

        public UnionFind(int n)
        Instantiates an emtpy union-find data structure with n nodes, [0, n). If data type for node id's isn't an int, use a Symbol Table (i.e. HashMap) to convert to int for UF Algorithm: Weighted Quick Union Constructor: O(n) | Union: O(lg n) | Find: O(lg n)
        Parameters:
        n - the number of nodes
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if n < 0

    • Method Detail

      • find

        public int find(int p)
        Return component id for p
        Parameters:
        p - a node parent
        Returns:
        component parent for component w/ p
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if p < 0 or p >= parent.length

      • union

        public void union(int v,
                  int w)
        Creates an edge between vertices v and w, merging the two nodes together
        Parameters:
        v - the first node
        w - the second node
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if not both 0 <= v < n and 0 <= w < n

      • count

        public int count()
        Returns the number of connected components
        Returns:
        the number of connected components

      • connected

        public boolean connected(int v,
                         int w)
        Returns if two nodes are in the same component
        Parameters:
        v - one node
        w - the other node
        Returns:
        true if v and w are connected else false
        Throws:
        java.lang.AssertionError - if not both 0 <= v < n and 0 <= w < n

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string reperesentation of the UnionFind data structure
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        A string with the number of components

                 throws java.io.IOException
        Demonstration of the abilities of this UnionFind implementation
        Parameters:
        args - the terminal arguments
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - if the specified file doesn't exist
